title: An Erd\H{o}s-Ko-Rado type theorem for subgraphs of perfect matchings
abstract:
Let $M_k$ be a $2n$-vertex graph with $n$ pairwise disjoint edges and let
$\mathcal{H}^{(p,s)}(n)$ be the family of subsets of $V(M_n)$ that span exactly
$p$ edges and $s$ isolated vertices. We prove that for $n\ge 2p+s$ this family
has the Erd\H{o}s--Ko--Rado property: the size of the largest intersecting
family equals to the number of sets containing a fixed vertex. The bound $n\ge
2p+s$ is the best possible, improving a recent theorem with $n\ge 2p+2s$ by
Fuentes and Kamat.
